member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for the ServiceBus extension.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.PrefetchCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the PrefetchCount that will be used when receiving messages. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.ClientRetryOptions
member.summary: The set of options to use for determining whether a failed operation should be retried and, if so, the amount of time to wait between retry attempts. These options also control the amount of time allowed for receiving messages and other interactions with the Service Bus service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.TransportType
member.summary: The type of protocol and transport that will be used for communicating with the Service Bus service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.WebProxy
member.summary: The proxy to use for communication over web sockets.
member.remarks: A proxy cannot be used for communication over TCP; if web sockets are not in use, specifying a proxy is an invalid option.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.AutoCompleteMessages
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to automatically complete messages after successful execution of the function. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.MaxAutoLockRenewalDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum duration within which the lock will be renewed automatically. This value should be greater than the longest message lock duration; for example, the LockDuration Property. The default value is 5 minutes. This does not apply for functions that receive a batch of messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.MaxConcurrentCalls
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of messages that can be processed concurrently by a function. This setting does not apply for functions that receive a batch of messages. The default is 16 times the return value of . When is true, this value will be ignored, and concurrency will be increased/decreased dynamically.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.MaxConcurrentSessions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of sessions that can be processed concurrently by a function. The default value is 8. This does not apply for functions that receive a batch of messages. When is true, this value will be ignored, and concurrency will be increased/decreased dynamically.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.ProcessErrorAsync
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional error handler that will be invoked if an exception occurs while attempting to process a message. This does not apply for functions that receive a batch of messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.SessionInitializingAsync
member.summary: Optional handler that can be set to be notified when a new session is about to be processed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.SessionClosingAsync
member.summary: Optional handler that can be set to be notified when a session is about to be closed for processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.MaxMessageBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of messages that will be passed to each function call. This only applies for functions that receive a batch of messages. The default value is 1000.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.SessionIdleTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time to wait for a message to be received for the currently active session. After this time has elapsed, the processor will close the session and attempt to process another session. If not specified, the will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.JsonSerializerSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON serialization settings to use when binding to POCOs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.EnableCrossEntityTransactions
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether or not transactions may span multiple Service Bus entities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusOptions.Microsoft#Azure#WebJobs#Hosting#IOptionsFormatter#Format
member.summary: Formats the options as JSON objects for display.
member.returns: Options formatted as JSON.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.MessageProcessor
member.summary: This class defines a strategy used for processing Service Bus messages.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.MessageProcessor.#ctor(Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusProcessor)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The to use for processing messages from Service Bus.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.MessageProcessor.Processor
member.summary: Gets or sets the that will be used by the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.MessageProcessor.BeginProcessingMessageAsync(Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageActions,Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method is called when there is a new message to process, before the job function is invoked. This allows any preprocessing to take place on the message before processing begins.
member.param: The set of actions that can be performed on a .
The to process.
A cancellation token that will be cancelled when the processor is shutting down.
member.returns: A that returns true if the message processing should continue, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.MessageProcessor.CompleteProcessingMessageAsync(Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageActions,Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage,Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Executors.FunctionResult,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method completes processing of the specified message, after the job function has been invoked.
member.remarks: The message is completed by the ServiceBus SDK based on how the option is configured. E.g. if is false, it is up to the job function to complete the message.
member.param: The set of actions that can be performed on a .
The to process.
The from the job invocation.
A cancellation token that will be cancelled when the processor is shutting down.
member.returns: A that will complete the message processing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.MessagingProvider
member.summary: This class provides factory methods for the creation of instances used for Service Bus message processing. It can be overriden to customize any of the client creation methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageActions.AbandonMessageAsync(Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Abandons a .This will make the message available again for immediate processing as the lock on the message held by the receiver will be released.
member.param: The to abandon.
The properties of the message to modify while abandoning the message.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.remarks: Abandoning a message will increase the delivery count on the message. This operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver when is set to .
member.returns: A task to be resolved on when the operation has completed.

item.description: The lock for the message has expired or the message has already been completed. This does not apply for session-enabled entities. The will be set to in this case.
The lock for the session has expired or the message has already been completed. This only applies for session-enabled entities. The will be set to in this case.

item.description: The lock for the message has expired or the message has already been completed. This does not apply for session-enabled entities. The will be set to in this case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageActions.DeferMessageAsync(Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Indicates that the receiver wants to defer the processing for the message.
member.param: The to defer.
The properties of the message to modify while deferring the message.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.remarks:
In order to receive this message again in the future, you will need to save the
and receive it using . Deferring messages does not impact message's expiration, meaning that deferred messages can still expire. This operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver.
member.returns: A task to be resolved on when the operation has completed.

item.description: The lock for the message has expired or the message has already been completed. This does not apply for session-enabled entities. The will be set to in this case.
The lock for the session has expired or the message has already been completed. This only applies for session-enabled entities. The will be set to in this case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageActions.RenewMessageLockAsync(Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Renews the lock on the message. The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the queue.
member.remarks: When a message is received in mode, the message is locked on the server for this receiver instance for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation (LockDuration). If processing of the message requires longer than this duration, the lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the message is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.
member.param: The to renew the lock for.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.exception: The lock for the message has expired or the message has already been completed. The will be set to in this case.

member.summary: Receives a list of from the entity. This method doesn't guarantee to return exact `maxMessages` messages, even if there are `maxMessages` messages available in the queue or topic. Messages received using this method are subject to the behavior defined in the . When this method is used in a single-dispatch functions, messages received are subject to .
member.param: The maximum number of messages that will be received.
An optional specifying the maximum time to wait for the first message before returning an empty list if no messages are available. If not specified, the will be used.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.returns: List of messages received. Returns an empty list if no message is found.

An containing the sequence numbers to receive.
member.returns: Messages identified by sequence number are returned. Throws if the messages have not been deferred.
member.exception: The specified sequence number does not correspond to a message that has been deferred. The will be set to in this case.

member.summary: Set a custom state on the session which can be later retrieved using
member.param: A of session state
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.remarks: This state is stored on Service Bus forever unless you set an empty state on it.
member.returns: A task to be resolved on when the operation has completed.
member.exception: The lock for the session has expired. The will be set to in this case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusSessionMessageActions.ReleaseSession
member.summary: Releases the session that is being processed. No new receives will be initiated for the session before the session is closed. Any already received messages will still be delivered to the user message handler, and in-flight message handlers will be allowed to complete. Messages will still be completed automatically if is true. The session may end up being reopened for processing immediately after closing if there are messages remaining in the session ( This depends on what other session messages may be in the queue or subscription).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.ServiceBusSessionMessageActions.RenewSessionLockAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Renews the lock on the session specified by the . The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the entity.
member.param: An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.

remarks.para: When you accept a session, the session is locked for this receiver by the service for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation. If processing of the session requires longer than this duration, the session-lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the session is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.
Renewal of session renews all the messages in the session as well. Each individual message need not be renewed.

member.exception: The lock for the session has expired. The will be set to in this case.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBusAccountAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to override the default ServiceBus account used by triggers and binders.
member.remarks: This attribute can be applied at the parameter/method/class level, and the precedence is in that order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBusAccountAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: A string value indicating the Service Bus connection string to use. This string should be in one of the following formats. These checks will be applied in order and the first match wins. - The name of an "AzureWebJobs" prefixed app setting or connection string name. E.g., if your setting name is "AzureWebJobsMyServiceBus", you can specify "MyServiceBus" here. - Can be a string containing %% values (e.g. %StagingServiceBus%). The value provided will be passed to any INameResolver registered on the JobHostConfiguration to resolve the actual setting name to use. - Can be an app setting or connection string name of your choosing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBusAccountAttribute.Account
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the app setting that contains the Service Bus connection string.

member.summary: Gets or sets the app setting name that contains the Service Bus connection string.

array
